Sentencas: A thermally stable and self-sustainable portable energy conversion system is designed using low temperature thin film SOFCs (solid oxide fuel cells).
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: Hydrogen and air gases are fed into this system, which is successfully operated at 319 degrees C. Each cell, comprised of Pt (anode)/YSZ-GDC-YSZ/Pt (cathode), is manufactured using sputtering and atomic layer deposition, and the area of a single cell is 2.56 cm(2).
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: The maximum absolute power and power densities at 500 degrees C are measured to be 44 mW and 17 mW cm(-2), respectively.
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: To the best of our knowledge, this represents the highest absolute power reported at such a low operating temperature regime.
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: To increase the system's temperature, a catalytic burner using Al2O3 and a Pt catalyst is manufactured by dip-coating.
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: After hydrogen gas and air pass through the anode and cathode sides, respectively, the mixed fuel gases are supplied to the catalytic burner, which undergoes an exothermic reaction.
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)

Sentencas: We successfully demonstrate that this system is heated up to 319 degrees C (from room temperature) without any other initial heat source; we also measure the electrical power simultaneously.
Titulo: A thermally self-sustaining solid oxide fuel cell system at ultra-low operating temperature (319 °C)
